repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: Foote, Cone & Belding Communications, Inc. records 1964-1978 and undated
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: The Foote, Cone & Belding advertising agency (FCB) was formed in 1942 when Albert Lasker sold the Lord & Thomas agency to three of his executives. A pioneer in television advertising, FCB later merged with Draft Direct Worldwide to become Draftfcb, a subsidiary of The Interpublic Group, and one of the largest advertising agencies in the United States. The Foote, Cone & Belding Communications, Inc. Records span the years 1964-1978 and consists of audiotapes, videocassettes, 16mm film, focus group studies, television schedules, scripts and photoboards from television commercials. Clients include Armour-Dial, Burger King, Hormel, Interstate Brands (Wonder Bread), Johnson & Johnson, Kraft, Pizza Hut, McDonald's, S.C. Johnson, Sears & Roebuck, Western Electric, and Zenith. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [name of item], Foote, Cone & Belding Communications, Inc. Records, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Foote, Cone & Belding Communications, Inc. Records were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as gifts in 1993 and 2002.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Diana Poythress, September 2010; additional processing by Richard Collier, May 2011
Encoded by Diana Poythress and Richard Collier, May 2011
Accessions 93-144 and 2002-0271 have been merged into one collection, described in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Historical Note

chronitem.event: Albert Lasker retires and sells L&T to executives Emerson Foote, Fairfax Cone and Don Belding
Foote, Cone & Belding becomes a publicly traded corporation
Foote, Cone & Belding renamed True North Communications
The Interpublic Group of Companies buys True North Communications and restores the name Foote, Cone & Belding
Foote, Cone & Belding merges with Draft Direct Worldwide to become Draftfcb

bioghist.p: Sources: Encyclopedia of Chicago entry on Foote Cone & Belding; Adbrands entry on Draftfcb.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Foote, Cone & Belding Communications, Inc. Records span the years 1964-1978 and consists of audiotapes, videocassettes, 16mm film, focus group studies, television schedules, scripts and photoboards from television commercials. Clients include Armour-Dial, Burger King, Hormel, Interstate Brands (Wonder Bread), Johnson & Johnson, Kraft, Pizza Hut, McDonald's, S.C. Johnson, Sears & Roebuck, Western Electric, and Zenith.

arrangement.head: Collection Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is arranged into four series: General Files; Photoboards; Scripts; and Audiovisual Materials.

scopecontent.p: Includes communication and focus group studies, corporate library guide, and television schedules. Arranged alphabetically.

did.unittitle: Corporate Library-Guide to the FCB Information Center, 1978 May

scopecontent.p: Includes original and aired photoboards, frames of television commercials. Aired photoboards include locations, date, and programming information.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by product type, then by products. Variations in spelling reflect variations in the files.

Includes handwritten, original, and completed scripts of television commercials. Tape numbers are transcribed from the original folders; the tapes themselves do not reside in this collection.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by advertiser, then by script number. Variations in spelling reflect variations as written in the files.
